title: How to Make Watermelon Sorbet

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
For this sorbet, you will need:
Watermelon
Condensed milk.

steps.headline: Remove all the seeds from the watermelon.
steps.description: Also remove the rind.

steps.headline: Cut the watermelon flesh into pieces.
Place the watermelon pieces into a blender or food processor.
steps.description: Pour condensed milk over the pieces to cover. Blend or process until smooth.

steps.headline: Pour the watermelon and milk mixture into a freezer-proof tray with rims (higher edges).
steps.description: Place in the freezer and let it freezer.

steps.headline: Remove from the freezer and serve immediately.
steps.description: Do not let it sit around, or it will change back into watermelon juice.

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
For this sorbet, you will need:
1 cup sugar
1 cup water
8 cups seedless watermelon
2 tablespoons lemon juice
Mint leaves or chocolate leaves, as garnish.

steps.headline: Make the sugar syrup.
steps.description: Add the sugar and water to the saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring frequently. When the sugar has dissolved and a sticky liquid has formed, remove from the heat. Set aside and allow to cool.

steps.headline: Add the watermelon pieces (in batches) to the food processor or blender.
steps.description: Process or blend until smooth and transfer each batch to the large bowl. Continue until all of the watermelon has been processed.

steps.headline: Pour the sugar syrup and the lemon juice into the pureed or blended watermelon.
steps.description: Mix through to combine.

steps.headline: Pour the liquid into the dish.
steps.description: Place in the freezer and allow to freeze until firm. This will be about an hour or so.

steps.headline: When frozen, remove from the freezer.
steps.description: Puree the frozen watermelon sorbet in batches, then place straight into serving bowls.

steps.headline: Serve immediately.
steps.description: Add a garnish of a mint leaf or a chocolate leaf, if wished.

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
For this sorbet, you'll need:
1 medium watermelon (approx. 2 lb or 1kg)
1 cup/ 200g granulated sugar
1 cup/250ml water
1/4 cup/60ml freshly squeezed lemon juice
Fresh mint leaves, for garnish.

steps.headline: Ensure that the watermelon you're using is presentable, as it forms part of the appeal when placed on the table.
steps.description: Choose a watermelon without blemishes or nicks in its skin.

steps.headline: Make the sugar syrup.
steps.description: Add the sugar and water to the saucepan. Heat over a medium heat, then bring to a boil, and reduce to a simmer. Stir constantly for two to three minutes, or until the sugar completely dissolves. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool.

steps.headline: Prepare the watermelon.
steps.description: Slice a little off the base of the watermelon so that it will sit without rolling. You can make the base either sideways or vertical, whichever way you'd prefer to display the watermelon. Cut off the top third of the watermelon. Scoop the flesh out with care, using a dessertspoon. Take care to leave the skin completely intact. Remove the seeds from the flesh.

steps.headline: Transfer the prepared watermelon base and lid to a baking sheet or tray.
steps.description: Place into the freezer. It will remain in here until serving time.

steps.headline: Prepare the sorbet.
steps.description: Place the watermelon flesh into the blender or food processor. Add the lemon juice. Process until smooth.

steps.headline: Pour the processed watermelon into the cooled sugar syrup.
steps.description: Pour the resulting mixture into your usual ice cream maker. Freeze following the manufacturer's instructions. If you don't have an ice cream maker, use a baking dish. Freezer for an hour, then remove and chop up the sorbet with a fork and return to the freezer to freeze again.

steps.headline: Transfer the watermelon sorbet to the frozen base.
steps.description: For a really fancy touch, pipe the top layer in to make it appear more interesting. Add a mint leaf or two for garnish, then place the lid on top.

steps.headline: Serve immediately.
steps.description: Provide a scoop or large spoon for guests to help themselves from the watermelon base.

steps.headline: Gather the ingredients.
steps.description:
For this sorbet, you'll need:
1/2 or 1 watermelon
Freshly squeezed lemon juice
Chocolate chips (milk or dark).

steps.headline: Prepare the watermelon.
steps.description: Cut the rind off the watermelon and remove the pips.

steps.headline: Cut the watermelon into chunks.
steps.description: Place the chunks onto a wax or silicone mat lined cookie sheet or tray. Place in the freezer overnight.

steps.headline: Remove the chunks from the freezer when you're ready to make the sorbet.
steps.description: Add the frozen pieces and lemon juice in batches to the blender or food processor. Blend or process until smooth (add a little more lemon juice or water if the processing gets hard). Be sure to use a strong blender or processor.

steps.headline: Transfer the blended or processed frozen watermelon to a large bowl.
Drop in the chocolate chips and mix through.
steps.description: These will look like the pips.

steps.headline: Serve immediately.
steps.description: Provide a serving scoop or spoon and some serving dishes for diners to help themselves to.

text:
Milky watermelon sorbet Gather the ingredients. For this sorbet, you will need:
Watermelon
Condensed milk. Remove all the seeds from the watermelon. Also remove the rind. Cut the watermelon flesh into pieces.  Place the watermelon pieces into a blender or food processor. Pour condensed milk over the pieces to cover. Blend or process until smooth. Pour the watermelon and milk mixture into a freezer-proof tray with rims (higher edges). Place in the freezer and let it freezer. Remove from the freezer and serve immediately. Do not let it sit around, or it will change back into watermelon juice. Simple watermelon sorbet Gather the ingredients. For this sorbet, you will need:
1 cup sugar
1 cup water
8 cups seedless watermelon
2 tablespoons lemon juice
Mint leaves or chocolate leaves, as garnish. Make the sugar syrup. Add the sugar and water to the saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring frequently. When the sugar has dissolved and a sticky liquid has formed, remove from the heat. Set aside and allow to cool. Add the watermelon pieces (in batches) to the food processor or blender. Process or blend until smooth and transfer each batch to the large bowl. Continue until all of the watermelon has been processed. Pour the sugar syrup and the lemon juice into the pureed or blended watermelon. Mix through to combine. Pour the liquid into the dish. Place in the freezer and allow to freeze until firm. This will be about an hour or so. When frozen, remove from the freezer. Puree the frozen watermelon sorbet in batches, then place straight into serving bowls. Serve immediately. Add a garnish of a mint leaf or a chocolate leaf, if wished. Watermelon sorbet inside the watermelon Gather the ingredients. For this sorbet, you'll need:
1 medium watermelon (approx. 2 lb or 1kg)
1 cup/ 200g granulated sugar
1 cup/250ml water
1/4 cup/60ml freshly squeezed lemon juice
Fresh mint leaves, for garnish. Ensure that the watermelon you're using is presentable, as it forms part of the appeal when placed on the table. Choose a watermelon without blemishes or nicks in its skin. Make the sugar syrup. Add the sugar and water to the saucepan. Heat over a medium heat, then bring to a boil, and reduce to a simmer. Stir constantly for two to three minutes, or until the sugar completely dissolves. Remove from the heat and set aside to cool. Prepare the watermelon. Slice a little off the base of the watermelon so that it will sit without rolling. You can make the base either sideways or vertical, whichever way you'd prefer to display the watermelon. Cut off the top third of the watermelon. Scoop the flesh out with care, using a dessertspoon. Take care to leave the skin completely intact. Remove the seeds from the flesh. Transfer the prepared watermelon base and lid to a baking sheet or tray. Place into the freezer. It will remain in here until serving time. Prepare the sorbet. Place the watermelon flesh into the blender or food processor. Add the lemon juice. Process until smooth. Pour the processed watermelon into the cooled sugar syrup. Pour the resulting mixture into your usual ice cream maker. Freeze following the manufacturer's instructions. If you don't have an ice cream maker, use a baking dish. Freezer for an hour, then remove and chop up the sorbet with a fork and return to the freezer to freeze again. Transfer the watermelon sorbet to the frozen base. For a really fancy touch, pipe the top layer in to make it appear more interesting. Add a mint leaf or two for garnish, then place the lid on top. Serve immediately. Provide a scoop or large spoon for guests to help themselves from the watermelon base. Watermelon and chocolate sorbet Gather the ingredients. For this sorbet, you'll need:
1/2 or 1 watermelon
Freshly squeezed lemon juice
Chocolate chips (milk or dark). Prepare the watermelon. Cut the rind off the watermelon and remove the pips. Cut the watermelon into chunks. Place the chunks onto a wax or silicone mat lined cookie sheet or tray. Place in the freezer overnight. Remove the chunks from the freezer when you're ready to make the sorbet. Add the frozen pieces and lemon juice in batches to the blender or food processor. Blend or process until smooth (add a little more lemon juice or water if the processing gets hard). Be sure to use a strong blender or processor. Transfer the blended or processed frozen watermelon to a large bowl.  Drop in the chocolate chips and mix through. These will look like the pips. Serve immediately. Provide a serving scoop or spoon and some serving dishes for diners to help themselves to.
